thread.title: Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road
thread.title_full: Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road
text:
Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road The Bears have lost two in a row in the tight Big 12. Post to Facebook Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road The Bears have lost two in a row in the tight Big 12.  //usat.ly/2kAujjc   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Kansas State holds on to beat No. 3 Baylor on the road USA TODAY Sports 5:11 p.m. ET Feb. 4, 2017 Baylor's Al Freeman tries to shoot over Kansas State forward D.J. Johnson. (Photo: Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports) 
Kansas State upset No. 3 Baylor 56-54 on Saturday in Waco, Texas, tightening the race in the Big 12. 
The Wildcats led by as many as 19 points, and were up 15 at halftime, but had to hold on after Baylor got within one point in the final 30 seconds. 
The Bears (20-3, 7-3) have lost two in a row, coming off Thursday's setback at No. 2 Kansas. The Bears had a chance to pull even in the conference standings with the Jayhawks, who were stunned at home on Saturday by Iowa State. 
Baylor can right the ship this week with games at Oklahoma State on Wednesday and at home vs. TCU on Saturday. 
The Wildcats improved their record to 16-7, 5-5 in the Big 12. NEVER MISS OUT Sports Stay in the know and in the zone, 7 days a week, with scores, analysis, and in-depth features and commentary. THANKS FOR SIGNING UP FOR THE Sports NEWSLETTER
